body.p: I very seldom presume to interfere in things of this nature but feel calld on to say something on behalf of Col Gorin chargd with maliciously shooting M C Wood. Mr Wood has entirely recovered. The Col as you know is an old respected member of the bar he is very much troubled so much as to almost unsettle his mind he is very much to be pitied He certainly had no malice against Mr Wood The shooting was done under very great excitement and the Col labourd under the impression that Mr Wood a powerful and much younger man had struck him and in the act of following up his blows when he fird Public opinion so far as I can gather it is universal that Col Gorin ought to be pardoned in this my own feelings & Judgement as a man and law abiding citizen fully concurs. I trust that you will find no difficulty in relieving Col Gorin
